paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the efficacy and safety of tafamidis in treating transthyretin amyloid cardiomyopathy (ATTR-CM) and mentions several TTR variants associated with the disease.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P1 was diagnosed at age 64 with symptoms of heart failure.
Patient P2 presented with significant cardiac involvement at age 69.
Patient P3 remains asymptomatic at age 72.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Heart failure symptoms with reduced ejection fraction
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P4 was diagnosed with heart failure at age 74.

functional_data.summary: The TTR variant Val122Ile is associated with increased amyloid fibril formation.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in families, particularly in families with a history of ATTR-CM.
variants.population_frequency: Variant frequency in gnomAD is approximately 0.02% in European populations.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on clinical observations and family studies.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the importance of genetic screening in patients with ATTR-CM.
key_quotes: Specific TTR mutations, such as Val122Ile, are commonly associated with ATTR‐CM.
Patients with the Val122Ile variant often present with heart failure symptoms.

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was extracted thoroughly from the main text, with a focus on TTR variants.
